üî•
 November 30th, 2025 to December 8th, 2025
@RNN_Alerts
 timelapse tracking 474 bombing, drone, clashes, settler attacks, and shootings alerts across the region.
This visualization shows every alert documented from November 30 to December 8, 2025, across Gaza, West Bank, Lebanon, Syria, and overall.

In the Novopavlivka direction, over the last few weeks Ukrainian forces have been carrying out a series of counterattacks aimed at recapturing Novopavlivka.
After the earlier Russian breakthrough into the town and a large-scale FPV drone striking campaign on Russian positions, Ukrainian forces were able to contain the Russian advances and begin pushing back. They re-entered the northwestern streets, and in coordination with attacks from the northeast and southwest, pushed the Russians back beyond the Solena River. From there, the Ukrainians consolidated in the northern streets and began a general push back to the town centre, reaching and establishing control over it. 
Additionally, despite earlier withdrawals, the Ukrainians were able to dig in east of Novopavlivka and begin pushing back towards its rear, advancing along several treelines and recapturing positions along the western face of the tactical heights. They are now trying to infiltrate even further south, entrenching south of Novopavlivka and reaching the gulley east of Filiya where they are attempting to clear the strongpoints there. 
As a result of these attacks, and attempts to cross the Solena River from the west, the remaining Russian formations in Novopavlivka are operationally encircled and have no ground supply lines leading to their positions. 
Meanwhile, to the southwest, Russian forces resumed their assault operations northwest of Filiya and established control over the rest of the fortified forest there, pushing the Ukrainians back to the treelines further north.
+ ~23.60 km¬≤ in favour of Ukraine.
+ ~0.83 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Dobropillya direction, Russian forces continued to advance near Pokrovsk and in Myrnohrad, capturing new important positions in several different areas.
In the west, Russian forces continued advancing through Hryshyne where they captured new positions in the southeastern part of the village on both banks of the Hrishynka River.
To the east, Russian forces cleared the grey zone north of Pokrovsk, establishing control over the treelines there and widening the corridor separating the Myrnohrad pocket with the rest of the front. Infiltration attempts to the second pig farm complex westwards along the road were also resumed.
In the northwestern part of the Myrnohrad pocket, Russian forces managed to consolidate in the last part of Rivne in the northeast of the village, and building on their success, entered the neighbouring village of Svitle. They were able to quickly establish control over the western and central part of the settlement, pushing the Ukrainians back towards the northwestern edge of Myrnohrad.
In the southern part of the pocket, Russian forces continued incrementally advancing north towards Myrnohrad city centre, reaching Stusa Street and beginning infiltrations further towards the high-rise buildings of the 40th District. They also captured the remaining apartment buildings of the Zapadny District, including the local kindergarten.
In the north, Russian forces continued to slowly advance through Rodynske, and after heavy fighting managed to break through the Ukrainian defence in the three-story buildings near Myru Street, aligning the front with Shakhtarskoi Slavy Street. Heavy fighting continues for the remaining Ukrainian positions in the buildings between School No. 35 and Shakhtarskoi Slavy Street.
+ ~7.30 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Dobropillya and Druzhkivka directions, Russian forces continued their intensified assault operations and have made important progress in several different areas.
In the southwest, Russian forces recaptured the last parts of Nykanorivka and secured the nearby forests and treelines, levelling the frontline east of the railway line.
To the north, the Russians completed the capture of Dorozhnje and have begun advancing northwest up the railway line towards Novyi Donbas. Other forces infiltrated the village of Ivanivka, which is now in the grey zone.
To the northeast, Russian forces levelled the frontline along the Nove Shakhove - Shakhove Road, recapturing the remaining positions in the forest plantations there. Other forces captured the groves northeast of Nove Shakhove and began infiltrating further west past the village in the direction of Novyi Donbas.
To the east, the Russians captured the forest plantations on the northern bank of two reservoirs west of Shakhove and recaptured the positions north of Shakhove following the earlier Ukrainian counterattacks.
In the northeast, Russian forces continued advancing in and around Sofiivka and have consolidated in the agricultural buildings on the eastern outskirts of the village. They also crossed the Kazenyi Torets River, infiltrating the forest plantations on its western bank. The rest of Sofiivka is now in the grey zone. 
+ ~12.17 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.
Thai F-16 fighters have launched airstrikes on the town of Samraong, northern Cambodia (around 17 km from the border).

Footage showing the third Russian strike on the Pechenihy Dam in Kharkiv Oblast. This one was carried out with a Tornado-S rocket. 
The road over the Pechenihy Dam is one of the main logistical routes for Ukrainian forces for the Vovchansk - Kupyansk sector of the frontline.
Coordinates: 49.88225, 36.98039

 Footage of Cambodian forces firing BM-21 rockets toward the Surin-Oddar Meanchey border area.
@wfwitness

In the Kostyantynivka direction, Russian forces continued their assault operations in and around Kostyantynivka and have made new progress in four different areas.
In the northeast, following the capture of the tram depot on the northern edge of the Santurinivka District, Russian forces broke into the forest to the northeast, capturing positions there and in the trench fortifications in the adjacent fields. After accumulating, they pushed further northeast up the highway and forests, capturing the remaining positions south of the Dovhenka Arroyo Gulley, while other forces captured the remaining field fortifications near Predtechyne and the cafe on the eastern edge of the forest.
From there, Russian forces crossed the Dovhenka Arroyo Gulley and entered the northern part of the forests, infiltrating the Metallurg Dachas, the Khimik Dachas, the electrical substation, and the cemetary. DRGs moved even further north, entering the treelines northeast of Kostyantynivka. DRGs are also continuing to operate in the western forests and in the eastern streets of the Hora District.
To the southwest, Russian forces continued taking new positions in the Santurinivka District and consolidated in six more low-rise residential blocks southwest of the tram depot. They also managed to push the Ukrainians back out of the Michurina Dachas in southeastern Kostyantynivka. 
To the south, Russian forces continued slowly advancing north of the Kleban-Bykske Reservoir. They captured additional positions in the forests of the Kleban-Byk Landscape Park and expanded their zone of control in the trench fortifications west of Pleshchiivka.
+ ~9.53 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Overnight, in southern Syria, violent clashes took place between STG government forces and the Suweida Military Council (SMC) on the frontline west of Suweida City and in the area of Al Majdal. 
No casualties were reported, but power outages occurred in some settlements north of Suweida due to a stray bullet hitting a powerline.

Overnight, in southern Syria, violent clashes took place between STG government forces and the Suweida Military Council (SMC) on the frontline west of Suweida City and in the area of Al Majdal. 
No casualties were reported, but power outages occurred in some settlements north of Suweida due to a stray bullet hitting a powerline.

On the northwestern flank of Kostyantynivka, Russian forces continued their intensified assault operations and have advanced in two different areas.
In the northwest, Russian forces continued pushing west from the area of Maiske. They advanced west along a treeline, and west from the Maiske - Virolybuivka Road, capturing new positions on the tactical heights northeast of Virolybuivka. From there, Russian soldiers managed to enter the northern part of Virolybuivka, while DRGs infiltrated even further west and across the Novyi Reservoir in the direction of Klynove.
In the southeast, Russian forces began counterattacking in the southern suburbs of Chasiv Yar. They were able to recapture the Levanevskoho District, pushing the Ukrainians back to the southwestern Pivdennyi District.
+ ~4.50 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Russia is currently carrying out large-scale military exercises in the Far East.
At least 5 Tu-95MS strategic bombers from Ukrainka Airbase, ships from the pacific fleet stationed in Vladivostok, and an A-50U AWACS aircraft are taking part. 
The strategic bombers are carrying out simulated launches of Kh-101 cruise missiles with electronic warfare in the Sea of Japan. They are communicating ground controllers "Tainy, Bocheka, Rangut, Senokos, Vyazanka," and carrying out launch maneuvers with the launch code "333". 
These exercises will undoubtably delay the next large-scale, combined missile and drone attack on Ukraine involving strategic aviation, however there is still a possibility for large-scale missile attacks to take place without bombers due to a large number of Geran-2 drones still accumulated at launch sites, as well as recent Iskander-M deliveries to OTRK installations.

Russian media report that a Russian An-22 military transport aircraft crashed in Ivanovo Oblast. 
The plane reportedly had 7 crewmembers onboard at the time. Search and rescue operations are underway.

On the southwestern flank of Siversk, Russian forces continued to advance and have made significant progress across three different areas.
In the southwest, Russian forces managed to break through Ukrainian positions in the eastern part of Orikhovo-Vasylivka, quickly capturing the rest of this village which had held for over a year. Additionally, they were able to secure the treelines to the southwest and northeast, as well as the rest of the gulley to the east. From there, Russian forces pushed north to the forest along the E-40 Highway, capturing the southern part of it. In response to these somewhat sudden Russian advances, Ukraine blew up the Pryvillya Dam in an attempt to slow them down. 
To the northeast, Russian forces continued pushing west from the Bakhmutovka River. They consolidated in positions directly east of Pazeno, before entering the village, which is now in the grey-zone. They also managed to secure a number of the trenches north and northwest of Sakko i Vansetti which have held since March 2023. 
+ ~9.32 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Siversk and Lyman directions, Russian forces continued their assault operations and have made significant progress over the last week. 
In the southeast, Russian forces managed to consolidate in most of the high-rise buildings of northeastern Siversk. From there, they advanced southwest and captured the railway station, while other forces advanced west to the city centre. 
Additionally, Russian forces eliminated the pocket to the southeast of Siversk, and in coordination with attacks from the southern outskirts, established control over the southeastern part of the city, largely levelling the frontline along the railway line. Ukrainian forces have mostly withdrawn from the main part of Siversk east of the Bakhmutovka River, while Russian forces are attempting to infiltrate the western suburbs. They also managed to capture the terykon north of the city.
To the northwest, the Russians continued advancing beyond Platonivka and captured the forested gulley south of the village. They also advanced through the forest plantations to the southwest and captured the southeastern streets of Zakitne. 
Further northwest, Russian forces captured the remaining part of the forests north of Zakitne and cleared the positions in the forested area on the northern bank of the Siverskyi Donets River. 
To the west, the Russians captured the crossroads north of Ozerne and continue attempts to enter the northern part of the village amid fierce fighting. Additionally, Russian forces managed to capture the northern and eastern parts of Dibrova, as well as the forests to the east and southeast. Marginal advances also took place west of the two reservoirs in the direction of the highway.
+ ~29.57 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Coup Attempt Shakes France‚Äôs Grip On Benin
A coup d‚Äô√©tat was foiled in Benin on December 7, with signs of indirect intervention by France. The poor planning of the coup attempt suggests that it may have been a trap for dissatisfied officers. Still, the attempt highlighted the growing instability in the former French colony.
The coup attempt began in the early hours of December 7, with troops from the country‚Äôs National Guard attacking the residence of President Patrice Talon in the port city of Cotonou. The troops quickly seized the national broadcaster, and the home of Major General Abou Issa, the army chief of staff.
Eight of the troops declared on state television that Talon had been ‚Äúremoved from office as president of the republic‚Äù. They also announced the suspension of the constitution and state institutions, and identified themselves as the Military Committee for Refoundation [French: Comit√© Militaire pour la Refondation] (CMR) headed by Lieutenant Colonel Pascal Tigri.

Emboldened By Turkey, Damascus Is Gearing Up For Battle With Kurdish Forces
The deadline for the implementation of the integration agreement signed by the Islamist-led Syrian Interim Government and the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) in March is nearing the end of the year. No progress has been made yet, and both sides appear to be inching closer to a heated battle.
Despite reports of advance in talks on implementing the agreement, which is meant to integrate the SDF into the government‚Äôs civilian and military institutions, Al-Monitor revealed late in November that the process, mediated by the United States, has reached a halt.
Aldar Khalil, a senior official in the political wing of the SDF, revealed to the news outlet that there has been no communication from the government since October, accusing them of creating an ‚Äúillusion of process‚Äù ahead of President Ahmed al-Sharaa‚Äôs Washington visit earlier that month.

'Unprovoked Invasion': How The West Won The Narrative War
In 2013, Ukraine found itself at a crossroads. The former Soviet Republic was in dire financial¬†straits, and had been offered the opportunity to sign an association agreement with the¬†European Union. This would have fostered political and economic ties between Kiev and¬†Brussels, and been an incremental step towards Ukraine becoming a full-member of the bloc.
Ukraine‚Äôs Baltic neighbours Lithuania, Latvia, and Estonia had all become EU members in 2004,¬†and had also joined NATO in the same year. Ukraine becoming an EU member would have¬†resulted in a political, and potentially military, encirclement of Russia along its western border.
As well as the security risks posed by the association agreement, the ethnic makeup of Ukraine¬†was also a factor. The east of the country was composed primarily of ethnic Russians. This¬†included the Crimean Peninsula which was originally Russian territory, but ceded to Ukraine¬†during the Soviet-era.

The U.S. National Security Strategy: Signaling a Strategic Rift with Europe
The White House has officially approved its approach to the Ukrainian conflict. It presents a new vision of the current situation in Europe. The previously monolithic unity of the West is beginning to crack.
In November 2025, the U.S. government published a new National Security Strategy. This document significantly impacted the country's foreign policy. It outlines the primary issues in the realm of US national security and the planned solutions.
The strategy indicates the direction in which Americans will focus their political, economic, and military efforts in the coming years. The first edition of the strategy was released in 1987 during the Reagan administration. Since then, each administration has published at least one version of the strategy. The country's priorities have changed in line with the strategy.

Fighting Near Kupyansk: Ukraine Struggles To Keep Russian Army Away From Logistic Routes
Ukrainian forces made several attempts to attack the northern part of the Kupyansk encirclement. Russian units have established full control over the residential part of Sofiivka. 
European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen is pushing for the use of frozen Russian assets.
